2026-01-16.content:
Monitoring your internet-bound DNS queries for malicious activity using DNS Armor is generally available ([GA](https://cloud.google.com/products?e=48754805#product-launch-stages)).

For more information, see [Advanced threat detection with DNS Armor](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dns/docs/threat-detection).

summary.title: DNS Armor now generally available
summary.summary: Monitor your internet-bound DNS queries for malicious activity with DNS Armor, now generally available. This feature provides advanced threat detection to help protect your network. Learn more about securing your DNS traffic.

2025-09-30.content:
[Alias records](https://cloud.google.com/dns/docs/records-overview#alias-records) are available in [GA](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

This custom record type provides CNAME-like functionality at the zone apex, mapping the apex domain name to a canonical target.

summary.title: Alias Records Now Generally Available
summary.summary: Alias records are now available in Google Cloud. This feature provides CNAME-like functionality at the zone apex, mapping the apex domain name to a canonical target.

2025-08-29.content:
Monitoring your internet-bound DNS queries for malicious activity using advanced threat detection from DNS Armor is now available in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

For more information, see [Advanced threat detection overview](https://cloud.google.com/dns/docs/threat-detection).

summary.title: DNS Armor now in preview
summary.summary: Monitor your internet-bound DNS queries for malicious activity with DNS Armor's advanced threat detection, now available in preview.

2025-08-26.content:
DNS64 is available in [GA](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

DNS64 provides synthesized IPv6 addresses for IPv4 destinations. For more information, see the following:

* [DNS64 overview](https://cloud.google.com/dns/docs/overview#dns64-overview)
* [Configure DNS64 server policies](https://cloud.google.com/dns/docs/configure-dns64)

summary.title: DNS64 now generally available
summary.summary: The DNS64 feature is now generally available, allowing for synthesized IPv6 addresses for IPv4 destinations.

2025-06-30.content: Using a fully qualified domain name (FQDN) [forwarding target](https://cloud.google.com/dns/docs/zones/forwarding-zones) is available for outbound DNS forwarding in [GA](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: FQDN Support for Outbound DNS Forwarding
summary.summary: You can now use a fully qualified domain name for outbound DNS forwarding in Google Cloud. This feature is now generally available.
